parts: can you please give me a few visualizations of these numbers
Of course! Please upload the file containing the numbers or provide the data directly, and I will create some visualizations for you.

content.text:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Data for the two scenarios
data_1 = {
    "Month": ["January", "February", "March", "April", "May", "June", "July", "August", "September", "October", "November", "December"],
    "Base Salary": [4166.67]*12,
    "Sales Goal": [416666.67]*12,
    "Commission Rate": [4.2, 4.2, 4.2, 4.7, 4.7, 4.7, 5.2, 5.2, 5.2, 5.7, 5.7, 5.7],
    "Commission": [17500.00]*3 + [19583.33]*3 + [21666.67]*3 + [23750.00]*3,
    "Quarterly Bonus": [0, 0, 5000, 0, 0, 5000, 0, 0, 5000, 0, 0, 5000],
    "Annual Bonus": [0]*11 + [20000],
    "Total Monthly Compensation": [21666.67]*2 + [26666.67, 23750.00, 23750.00, 28750.00, 25833.33, 25833.33, 30833.33, 27916.67, 27916.67, 52916.67]
}

data_2 = {
    "Month": ["January", "February", "March", "April", "May", "June", "July", "August", "September", "October", "November", "December"],
    "Base Salary": [6250.00]*12,
    "Sales Goal": [416666.67]*12,
    "Commission Rate": [3.7, 3.7, 3.7, 4.2, 4.2, 4.2, 4.7, 4.7, 4.7, 5.2, 5.2, 5.2],
    "Commission": [12833.33]*3 + [14583.33]*3 + [16333.33]*3 + [18083.33]*3,
    "Quarterly Bonus": [0, 0, 5000, 0, 0, 5000, 0, 0, 5000, 0, 0, 5000],
    "Annual Bonus": [0]*11 + [20000],
    "Total Monthly Compensation": [19083.33]*2 + [24083.33, 20833.33, 20833.33, 25833.33, 22583.33, 22583.33, 27583.33, 24333.33, 24333.33, 49333.33]
}

# Creating dataframes
df_1 = pd.DataFrame(data_1)
df_2 = pd.DataFrame(data_2)

# Plotting
fig, axes = plt.subplots(2, 1, figsize=(12, 10))

# Scenario 1
axes[0].plot(df_1['Month'], df_1['Base Salary'], label='Base Salary')
axes[0].plot(df_1['Month'], df_1['Commission'], label='Commission')
axes[0].plot(df_1['Month'], df_1['Quarterly Bonus'], label='Quarterly Bonus')
axes[0].plot(df_1['Month'], df_1['Annual Bonus'], label='Annual Bonus')
axes[0].plot(df_1['Month'], df_1['Total Monthly Compensation'], label='Total Monthly Compensation')
axes[0].set_title('Scenario 1: Compensation Breakdown')
axes[0].set_xlabel('Month')
axes[0].set_ylabel('Amount ($)')
axes[0].legend()

# Scenario 2
axes[1].plot(df_2['Month'], df_2['Base Salary'], label='Base Salary')
axes[1].plot(df_2['Month'], df_2['Commission'], label='Commission')
axes[1].plot(df_2['Month'], df_2['Quarterly Bonus'], label='Quarterly Bonus')
axes[1].plot(df_2['Month'], df_2['Annual Bonus'], label='Annual Bonus')
axes[1].plot(df_2['Month'], df_2['Total Monthly Compensation'], label='Total Monthly Compensation')
axes[1].set_title('Scenario 2: Compensation Breakdown')
axes[1].set_xlabel('Month')
axes[1].set_ylabel('Amount ($)')
axes[1].legend()

plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

Matplotlib is building the font cache; this may take a moment.

parts:
Here are the visualizations for the two scenarios showing the compensation breakdown across different months. Each plot includes the Base Salary, Commission, Quarterly Bonus, Annual Bonus, and Total Monthly Compensation.

If you need more specific visualizations or further analysis, feel free to let me know!
can you visualize the differences between a commercial sales rep and a residential sales rep in this data set?

content.text:
# Adding labels for the two categories
df_1['Category'] = 'Commercial Sales Rep'
df_2['Category'] = 'Residential Sales Rep'

# Combining the two dataframes
df_combined = pd.concat([df_1, df_2])

# Plotting Total Monthly Compensation comparison
plt.figure(figsize=(12, 6))
for category in df_combined['Category'].unique():
    subset = df_combined[df_combined['Category'] == category]
    plt.plot(subset['Month'], subset['Total Monthly Compensation'], label=category)

plt.title('Total Monthly Compensation Comparison')
plt.xlabel('Month')
plt.ylabel('Total Monthly Compensation ($)')
plt.legend()
plt.show()

# Plotting Base Salary comparison
plt.figure(figsize=(12, 6))
for category in df_combined['Category'].unique():
    subset = df_combined[df_combined['Category'] == category]
    plt.plot(subset['Month'], subset['Base Salary'], label=category)

plt.title('Base Salary Comparison')
plt.xlabel('Month')
plt.ylabel('Base Salary ($)')
plt.legend()
plt.show()
